intro: Phyllonoma laticuspis, commonly known as the broad-lobed phyllonoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded understories of forests.
